Direct_Reports.label: Should we use role hierarchy to identify a personâ€™s manager?
Direct_Reports.description: Identifies who the person reports to. If not role hierarchy, we will use Manager ID field on user profile

Fiscal_Month.label: What month starts your fiscal period?
Fiscal_Month.description: Determines if fiscal is different from calendar.  We can support standard fiscal period.

FY_Month_Offset_Map.description: Internal mapping between fiscal year start months and offset, not to be displayed in UI.

Has_Product.label: Do you use the product object in Salesforce?
Has_Product.description: Answer yes if you track products at the opportunity level in Salesforce. If yes, answer the questions on the next screen. If no, skip to the end.

Has_Activities.label: Do you track activities with tasks and events?
Has_Activities.description: Determines if tasks and events are used in sales process

Has_Quota.label: Do you want to upload in Sales Wave the quota per sales person?
Has_Quota.description: Answer yes or no to indicate whether you track quotas for your salespeople. If yes, you have to upload a CSV file containing quota data.

Has_ForecastCategory.label: Do you use Forecast Category field to predict likelihood of closing?
Has_ForecastCategory.description: Determines if you use Forecast Category for pipeline management

Has_Security.label: Should we apply role level security?
Has_Security.description: Determines if we should restrict data access based on your role hierarchy

RoleSecurity.label: What's the best way to identify a person's manager?
RoleSecurity.description: Identifies who the person reports to

Opportunity_Amount.label: What field contains the total amount of the opportunity?
Opportunity_Amount.description: Select the field you use to track the total amount of the opportunity in Salesforce.

Bookings.label: What field indicates that an opportunity is new business?
Bookings.description: Select the field you use to identify that an opportunity in Salesforce is new business.

Customer.label: What is the first field you want to use to segment your customers?
Customer.description: Your choice determines the first-level grouping of customer data displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Customer_L2.label: What is the second field you want to use to segment your customers?
Customer_L2.description: Your choice determines the second-level grouping of customer data displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Geography.label: What is the first field you want to use to segment your geographies?
Geography.description: Your choice determines the first-level grouping of data about geographies displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Geography_L2.label: What is the second field you want to use to segment your geographies?
Geography_L2.description: Your choice determines the second-level grouping of data about geographies displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Source.label: What is the field from the Accounts object you want to use to segment your sources for finding new business?
Source.description: Your choice determines the first-level grouping of data about new business sources displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Source_L2.label: What is the field from the Opportunity object you want to use to segment your sources for finding new business?
Source_L2.description: Your choice determines the second-level grouping of data about new business sources displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Product_Amount.label: What field contains the total amount of a product on the opportunity?
Product_Amount.description: Select the field you use to track the total amount of the product on the opportunity in Salesforce.

Product.label: What is the first field you want to use to segment your products in Salesforce?
Product.description: Your choice determines the first-level grouping of product data displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Product_L2.label: What is the second field you want to use to segment your products in Salesforce?
Product_L2.description: Your choice determines the second-level grouping of product data displayed in Sales Wave dashboards.

Overrides.description: Internal configuration to allow asset creation overrides, not to be displayed in UI.
